attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Make the mechanics behind weight gain and loss compulsory for secondary schools
attributes.background: 64% of the UK population is overweight/obese. Many simply don’t understand why they are obese, and thus do not have the first idea of how to combat it. Basic information such as calculating Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) should be taught in secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
The average British person’s total daily energy expenditure is 2000 calories. Eating just 100 calories over this per day will lead to an average weight gain of nearly 10.5 pounds (4.7kg) a year. 100 calories is one large apple, half a plain bagel, or a packet of crisps.

Being overweight or obese is connected to many health problems, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, sleep apnoea and some cancers, as well as significantly reducing life expectancy and quality of life.

attributes.action: It should be law that the Governor of the Bank of England is a UK Citizen
attributes.background: The UK leads the world in its financial expertise, and there are UK citizens experienced in this field that could do the job, but the position is currently held by a non UK national.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: Make the UK a permanent armed neutral country like Switzerland.
attributes.background: Since Switzerland became an armed neutral power in 1815 the UK has approximately been involved in 50 conflicts and lost 1,540,462 UK military and civilian life's (20 of those conflicts and 7456 lifes have been lost since WW2).
attributes.additional_details: Becoming an armed nurtality country, would still enable us to keep our armed forces and deter or counter any invasion force to the UK or any overseas British territory.

attributes.action: Make the supplier of broadband supply the speed you should get and pay for
attributes.background: I should get 200 meg but only get 57 meg like most people on the supplier forum

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to set up sports teams for both genders.
attributes.background:
"Rugby is for boys," "Netball is for girls." 
Gender inequality in sport exists in schools, clubs and at the elite level.
All pupils should be encouraged to take part in any sport.  How hard is it to set up a rugby team for boys and a rugby team for girls? 
You can make a change!

attributes.action: Increase Government powers over interest rates to protect savers.
attributes.background: Since 2008 the Bank of England has relentlessly cut interest rates causing savers to lose a considerable amount of income and this has now reached an unacceptable level.  At the moment, the Government has limited power over interest rates.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls for greater Government powers of the Bank of England's interest rates, so that savers can be protected.

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: make it legal to revoke a step parent adoption
attributes.background:
I have parental responsibility over a child i have no actual connection with.
I feel in the long run the adoption does not benefit the child and could possibly harm them in the future when they are old enough to understand.
The situation i am in is harming my mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
I was in a same sex relationship and adopted my at the time partners child.
We are no longer together and myself and the child have no relationship.
Divorce is an option for married couples with no blood connection, step parents should also have this option when it does not harm the child.

attributes.action:
Remove the UK from membership of the UN.
This organisation has become a pariah.
attributes.background: The UN has presided over countless deaths of civilians over the years and has lost its way in the new world of aggression where all countries seek are weapons and power. We need a court like system, signed up to by all with real penalties for transgressors.
attributes.additional_details:
I offer history as a witness and evidence. Name one conflict resolved by the UN?
It has become clear since the 1960's that the UN is an organisation mired in politics and self interest. The rules created for countries to debate are being abused in a wholesale and cynical fashion. Their must be a better way by way of a court which member states adhere to or else they are dismissed from the organisation. The bailiffs of the court will be member countries having no interest in the actions at hand and able to use full force to achieve the edicts of the  court. No more should soldiers stand by and witness rape, murder and torture. No more should cynical members be able to abuse the courts decisions with a veto.

attributes.action: Require 30% of all restaurant tips to go towards chefs
attributes.background: The chefs work as hard or maybe even more so it is only fair they get some of the tips. Seeing as most chefs earn a bit less than waiters in most places and work twice as hard at most times.
attributes.additional_details: I have worked in many kitchens where no tips have been cut and have always been unfair and so do many people. I now work in a place where the tips get cut by 40% so that the kitchen has a little extra in their pocket, and it works so great and gives us an extra goal to work towards.

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS
attributes.background: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.
attributes.additional_details: Many people I have suggested this to seem to think it is a good idea.

attributes.action: Remove the pension lifetime allowance.We want to be self-reliant in retirement.
attributes.background: The current  lifetime allowance means we will not have enough pension income  in retirement. We want to have enough income so we are not reliant on the state and with a decent pension income, we will fuel the economy. This makes even more sense as the population is ageing. Please think again!
attributes.additional_details: As an example, a final salary pension of £18k p.a. eats up 58% of the lifetime allowance before any further pension savings are made. It does not leave much headroom and will not equate to extravagant riches in old age. Please reconsider the lifetime allowance limit.

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: End the inequality and offer fathers the same paternity leave as mothers.
attributes.background:
Women in the UK are entitled to paid maternity leave up to 39 weeks. 

Men only get 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
To deny fathers the same benefit is unfair, unequal and sexist, the father should be available to help the mother of a new born child, a very difficult time for many families. For up to 39 weeks with pay as women are. 
Many women who have C sections or difficult births require extra care, especially if they already have an older child. 
2 weeks leave is not suitable or long enough to allow a father to bond with a new baby and to aid the recovery of his partner after child birth/C section.

attributes.action: Abolish unfair 'blanket pet bans' for leaseholders
attributes.background:
Homeowners should have the right to keep pets in their property. Leasehold homes are increasing, yet blanket pet bans are hidden in T&Cs. 

Blanket pet bans should be made invalid on all leasehold houses/flats & replaced with a fairer system that requires freeholders to review cases individually.
attributes.additional_details:
An estimated 1 in 2 homes has pets & freeholders are forcing leaseholders to part with these beloved family members. In 2015 the RSPCA rescued 118994 animals & Dogs Trust revealed 5142 stray dogs were put down that year. Pet bans will only add to this. With leasehold becoming more common, it’s reasonable to request blanket pet bans be abolished. It’s unfair to deny homeowners their pet without proper review. 

It was also deemed unfair by the ‘Unfair Terms in Consumer Contracts Regulations 1999’

attributes.action: Make companies prove equal pay for women
attributes.background: Women can expect to earn significantly less than men over their careers as a result of differences in caring responsibilities, clustering in low skilled and low paid work, the qualifications and skills women acquire, and outright discrimination. The overall gap is 13.9%.
attributes.additional_details: We were inspired to make this petition due to Iceland announcing today the decision to enforce companies of 25 or more staff to prove that they pay all employees the same regardless of gender, ethnicity, sexuality or nationality. If the UK Government is as dedicated to equality as they say they are, then they should force all companies to do the same.

attributes.action: Immediately remove license from ALL drivers if caught on  Phone while driving
attributes.background: Remove license with £200 fine for all drivers caught on phone

attributes.action: Make Care Leavers Exempt From Housing Benefit Cuts OR Provide Adequate Housing
attributes.background: Care leavers are seven times more likely to die before they hit 21!! And those who don't are highly likely to go onto offending, substance misuse, violent relationships and poor mental health etc due to the lack of support. Stop setting these young people up to fail!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabledgo.com/blog/2017/02/early-deaths-among-care-leavers-revealed/#.WL8HXcjfWJJ
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-33551256
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/37363544
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2015/jul/07/care-leavers-sucked-into-crime
http://www.barnardos.org.uk/get_involved/corporate_partnerships/barnardos-in-business/care_leavers__set_up_to_fail_.htm

attributes.action: Lower insurance premiums for 17- 25 year olds.<£1500
attributes.background: Earning minimum wage and cannot afford such a high insurance premium on such a low wage. Something needs to be done.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from the UK until Donald Trump's Muslim Ban is revoked.
attributes.background:
Donald Trump has imposed a disgusting ban on people from majority Muslim nations under the guise of a national security issue despite the fact that no terrorist attack on American soil has originated in those countries. 

We ask that all Americans be banned until Trump realises his error.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to implore the government to make a strong statement that Britain is against islamophobic policies and communicate this to Steve Bannon & Donald Trump in a language that they cannot ignore.

attributes.action: Release the 1921 Census records to the public now.
attributes.background: The latest Census records available to the public are way back in 1911. That's before the First World War. There are a lot of people trying to research their Family History but find it difficult with over 100 years gap on the National Census.
attributes.additional_details:
Signing this partition will help so many families to trace their roots  quicker and if we are successful the rule governing the release of Census records can be reduced from 100 years to 30.
Please check out this link and make up your mind 
http://www.abroadintheyard.com/access-1921-uk-census-now-30-arguments-for-against-early-release/

attributes.action: Make schools teach the dangers of using drugs and alcohol
attributes.background: Children become curious from a young age because not enough is being taught about this stuff in schools but like sex education they should be playing Video clips of the reality of what can happen when you take drugs and drink heavily, A once a week lesson in this could change many children's minds.

attributes.action: Ensure government treats mental and physical health equally on PIP eligibility.
attributes.background: The Department for Work and Pensions has been told by two court rulings to treat mental and physical health claimants equally by ensuring those with psychological health conditions are eligible for Personal Independence Payment.
attributes.additional_details: Psychological conditions such as anxiety incur additional costs of non NHS funded prescription medication for instance Finasteride which helps individuals attain some personal independence. Government rhetoric has insisted those with mental health conditions are treated equally with physical health conditions. While individuals with physical health conditions receive mobility assistance in the form of Personal Independence Payment, those with mental health conditions do not receive this.

attributes.action: Create a 2nd EU referendum which allows for those between 16-17 to vote.
attributes.background: The youth of the UK will have to live with the result of Brexit longer than anyone else, despite most young people not wanting to leave the EU in the first place. Those between the ages of 16-17 should be recognised by parliament for such an important decision, rather than being disregarded.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop foreign companies taking over British successful companies
attributes.background: Over the last 30 years, many of Britain’s successful and well known companies have been taking over by foreign companies, only to be broken up or their factories moved aboard. This new law would stop this practice if it was considered not be in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make Bullying in the workplace a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Bullying is wrong. Bullying goes on in the workplace.  It can be being left out , whatever it may be.  It can be being ignored.  It can be not getting that promotion.  Social media passive aggressive post. Commenting on work performance negatively, and talking in derogatory terms.
attributes.additional_details: Workplace Bullying is rife. A real problem, that can have severe consequences to a person being bullied. Just because a manager may smile at you, does not mean that they aren't bullying someone else.

attributes.action: Our schools are struggling due to funding cuts. Redirect foreign aid to schools
attributes.background: Our schools are struggling http://m.bristolpost.co.uk/olympus-headteacher-asks-parents-for-donations-as-budget-cuts-drive-schools-to-crisis-point/story-30155492-detail/story.html We are paying vast amounts to countries such as India who state they have not requested or need. Redirect to schools
attributes.additional_details: Schools are discussing four day weeks, increased class sizes and parent contributions as they struggle to afford to educate children in state schools due to increasing pupil numbers. It is the children of the less affluent in society those who cannot afford private education who will suffer making the divide between rich and poor educated even wider. Although it is commendable to help other countries it should not be at the expense of our children's future and their education

attributes.action: Discontinue religious education after Year 9
attributes.background: Learning about religion is a very important part of living in a fair, democratic society. However, the two hours spent weekly on RE could be of greater use for students studying for their GCSE's.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student, and my peers and I strongly believe that having those extra two hours would really help if used for revision, which will allow us to de-stress, and have time to be the children we're supposed to be.

attributes.action: Require autonomous vehicles to display a visible warning beacon when in motion.
attributes.background: As a software engineer with many years' experience, I  think that mixing AVs with conventional traffic on public roads is  highly risky, with potentially serious/fatal consequences for road users. It will require many years of development to perfect the tech in all weathers/conditions.
attributes.additional_details: There have already been several incidents reported in the USA.

attributes.action: Ban the delivery of charity collection bags to households in the U.K.
attributes.background: Large plastic charity bags, wrapped in plastic envelopes are delivered to thousands of households in the U.K. every week. Only a tiny percentage are filled for collection with the majority ending-up straight in the homeowners bin and off to landfill. This unnecessary use of plastic bags must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It is believed that 500,000 plastic charity collection bags are sent to landfill every year. Each bag is delivered inside yet another plastic bag envelope meaning some one million bags are disposed of in our landfill sites around the country every year, via doorstep delivery.
Most local council recycling stations, as well as many towns and villages retain clothing bins and can be freely used to dispose of such unwanted goods easily and without the need for such large scale waste.

attributes.action: Introduce knowledge on diversity and the LGBT+ to the primary school curriculum
attributes.background: If children are introduced to diversity and the lgbt+ community from a young age this could prevent racism and homophobia. Hate is taught not inate.
attributes.additional_details: Every single person i have encountered who support discrimination were either taught to do so or were only introduced to it via insults (e.g "that's so gay") however those of us who do not, tend to have been shown that skin colour or sexual orientation does not define a person. teaching young children about these topics and people can help them understand that everyone is different and nobody should never be ashamed of who they are.

attributes.action: Charge cyclists road tax and insurance,require to have side mirrors by law
attributes.background: Cyclists causes accidents ,damages and hold us drivers up . They should pay insurance in case they damage cars or are involved in rtc.they use our roads so they should pay some  road tax! Accidents could be prevented if riders were required to use Mirrors so they don't just pull out in front of us!
attributes.additional_details: They cause traffic ques. They have hold us up and we pay to use the road ...

attributes.action: Death sentence to offenders who kill and sexually abuse children under 16
attributes.background: Pedophiles should have no chances in doing this again to children once found out should receive the death sentence for the most serious counts of sexual abuse towards children kidnapping and death to children under 16 years of age and for not so serious a life sentence imposed meaning life in jail

attributes.action: Remove or greatly increase the petition character limit, currently capped at 880
attributes.background: The current character limit in petition descriptions is too small to include a highly meaningful body of evidence, argument, and other relevant information. Governmental ability to reply to petitions is notably unencumbered. People should be able to engage in responsive dialogue with the government.
attributes.additional_details: Many members of the public are informed on an extensive variety of subjects, ranging from obscure and niche, to popular and general interest. These people are ideally suited to approach the government via petition, to better educate the public and government alike. However, current character limitations means only small fragments of their expertise can be represented. Given the government's latitude in ability to respond to these petitions, the public should be granted similar levels of freedom.

attributes.action: Fund a working replica of Captain James Cook's Endeavour  and a Botanical Centre
attributes.background: Middlesbrough born Capt. James Cook discovered Botany Bay. 200yrs later the town produced the steel for the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
attributes.additional_details: In 2032 Australia will celebrate the 100th  anniversary of  the bridge. It will and has generated an enormous revenue into the country's economy. Middlesbrough should also be recognised. It will help the local economy if it becomes a place of  interest. This investment should form part of the Government's action plan published on 26th August 2016 to invest £40 million into tourism: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-invests-40-million-and-cuts-red-tape-to-boost-tourism-across-england

attributes.action: When the UK leaves the EU British passports should have pink covers.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is all about taking back control and making Britain great again. Let's set our sights high and, remembering the pink all across the globe just 100 years ago, let's have our British passports proudly clad in pink!

attributes.action: Provide income tax relief and remove insurance premium tax on health insurance.
attributes.background: The affordability and rapid uptake in the number of individuals and employing organisations taking out private health insurance across the uk would immediately ease the current pressure on the NHS. There would also be a rapid growth of private sector health care in the uk providing economic benefit.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently no financial incentive for individuals or organisations to take out private health care insurance.The NHS is left to pick up all the workloads and costs of large numbers of the uk population who would by choice move into private sector health care provision if the cost of premiums were lowered by incentives. This would rapidly reduce the demand on NHS services across the uk now and for the foreseeable future and stimulate growth and investment in private health care provision.

attributes.action: Make Personal Finances a core subject in education throughout the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Make personal finance a core subject through educat. This subject would cover interest rates on various bank accounts and the benefits for each. The subject would also inform students the risks of loans and credit cards and the correct way to keep a positive credit score.
attributes.additional_details: Students are leaving school without knowledge on personal finances and how best to manage their funds. General knowledge on council tax, mortgage rates and many more essential finance information is never taught, and therefore left to learn themselves over their young adulthood. Misinformation regarding loans and credit cards can cripple a young adults future credit scores, therefore effecting them for major life decisions.

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: Make schools have nit nurses back and children with lice stay home.
attributes.background: Are you sick and tired of your children getting headlice because parents are forced to send their children to school with headlice, as schools see education been more important than health? I certainly am. Help to get nit nurses back into schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents of children with headlice are been harrassed to send their children to school and the spread of lice continues. 
They think if a childs hair is tied up they can not be spread. Wrong.
They think as long as your actively trying to get rid of them, the child should be in school. Wrong.
Children with headlice should be kept off school until the headlice are completely gone and the nit nurse should be able to check before allowing a child back into school. 
A once a week visit would sufice.

attributes.action: Incentivise the switch from diesel to electric & low emission petrol vehicles.
attributes.background: Diesel vehicles cause thousands of deaths per year and unnecessarily put huge pressure on the health service. An incentivised scrap & switch scheme for diesel vehicles is the only way the government can ensure pollution is reduced and diesel cars are taken off the road.
attributes.additional_details:
"UK air pollution 'linked to 40,000 early deaths a year'" - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-35629034

"Diesel cars should be phased out to stop pollution deaths, says Chief Medical Officer " - http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/30/diesel-cars-should-phased-stop-pollution-deaths-says-chief-medical/

"Five facts about diesel the car industry would rather not tell you" - https://www.transportenvironment.org/sites/te/files/publications/2015_09_Five_facts_about_diesel_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: GCSE students should study their chosen subject from year 8.
attributes.background: I believe studying a GCSE is incredibly hard from personal experience, I have found that learning and subject for less that 2 years at GCSE isn't very usefully as it's hard to lear alll the content I believe that from year 8 we should start doing GCSE work because it would alllow for more practice.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, students would be benefited from this because their work would actually be at use by the time exams come around. Learning for year 8 would allow year 7 to be a year where you deciede what subjects you want to take at GCSE and with 4 years of learning this would allow students to possibly take on more GCSEs due to the increased learning time.

attributes.action: Make Ofsted Inspections in Schools a regular, unexpected thing without knowing
attributes.background: Teachers change how they teach and behave when ofsted are at the school. I think that ofsted should be unexpected and should be a last minute thing for teachers to know.

attributes.action: Leaving Care age to be raised to the August after 18th birthday if in education
attributes.background: Care leavers aged 18 in full time education should be classed as 'eligible' or 'relevant' until the 31st August after their 18th Birthday, to be entitled to accommodation and maintenance. This ceases at 18, when they become 'former relevant'. It is unfair to have to study whilst setting up a home.
attributes.additional_details:
The percentage of care leavers in further and higher education is statistically lower than their peers. Being able to manage and complete their education may prove to be a struggle when leaving care.
In terms of child benefit entitlement, a ‘qualifying young person’ can be aged 18 and 19 in full-time education. This extends financial support to young people post-18. Care leavers should have their support extended to the same age as they are some of the most vulnerable people in society.

attributes.action: Debate in parliament, the reduction in Foreign aid Budget.
attributes.background:
I have extensive experience within The Community Care Environment and am appalled by the parlous state in our Country at the moment.

We deliver foreign aid in billions-some of which is squandered-and we need to address our domestic health problems before we deliver this largesse to abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
Extensive knowledge of Social Care-previous Domiciliary Care provider to Suffolk County Council, and on board of Charities.

Evidence is clearly provided of our Health and Social Care meltdown, by looking in Communities, witnessing at close hand the downward-spiralling standards, to which we are subjecting our population, children, men and women
